Posts.Content: Jackson wrote: I'm getting one of these put in tomorrow.  Does anyone have one and can tell me a little about it? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pigtail Catheter Jackson debstitchestoo

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 06:16PM Jackson wrote: I have to stay overnight at the hospital tomorrow after they put it in.  But I won't have any home care.  They will teach me how to use it before I leave the hospital.  It was just decided today and I don't feel like I have much information like how big is whatever that sticks out?  I'm under the impression that the procedure itself is no big deal and I hope I'm right.
Posts.Title: Pigtail Catheter Jackson debstitchestoo

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 07:04PM Jackson wrote: Thanks Debbie.  Good luck to you on Friday  too.  I saw your email on bcmets and was waiting for someone to reply.  Seems these aren't very common but I guess they're sort of new.  I agree about thorocentesis, mine was much worse than I expected it to be.  I'd never have one of those again.  Hope it goes well.  I'll check next week and see if you've posted or email me if you want.  Jacki
Posts.Title: Pigtail Catheter Jackson debstitchestoo

Posts.Content: Jackson wrote: I've been on chemo pretty much non stop for almost two years and in November found out I now have lung mets. I'm now on Navelbine, herceptin, arimidex, zoledex, the whole works and I feel like crap a lot of the time. I'm disappointed in people in my life. I don't know if they don't realize how serious this is or if they know and just don't care or don't know what to say. My dr. says it's important that I feel like I have enough support and I don't feel that way. It makes it hard to keep going. Anyone else feel like this? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Disappointed in people Jackson susan320
